subs.text: @zamishka @barttels2 Heh, that’s the ending of Black Mirror S1E2. Not word for word, but it rhymes.
subs.rawText: @zamishka @barttels2 Heh, that’s the ending of Black Mirror S1E2. Not word for word, but it rhymes.

subs.text: “Many breakthroughs in scientific progress have required massive funding and national coordination. This is not one of them. All that needs to be done is allow expert research scientists to do the hands-on work that they’ve been trained to do.” Spot on. [link]
subs.rawText:
“Many breakthroughs in scientific progress have required massive funding and national coordination. This is not one of them. All that needs to be done is allow expert research scientists to do the hands-on work that they’ve been trained to do.”

Spot on. https://t.co/mk66fLKp2t

subs.text: Gosh, this was a good movie. We expected flying cars and replicators, and instead the future couldn’t even muster up a good satire (Don’t Look Up is a pale copy). [link]
subs.rawText: Gosh, this was a good movie. We expected flying cars and replicators, and instead the future couldn’t even muster up a good satire (Don’t Look Up is a pale copy). https://t.co/ytkGtbdnQo

subs.text: To this I would add: replace "scientists" with "physicians" and "science" with "patient care" and the statement holds true. [link]
subs.rawText: To this I would add: replace "scientists" with "physicians" and "science" with "patient care" and the statement holds true. https://t.co/gW5B9pZ1h9

subs.text: “We can’t keep making so many scientists tear out their hair over well-intentioned but near-infinite administrative requirements, as if that doesn’t distract from the actual science that they are supposed to be doing.” Yes! [link]
subs.rawText:
“We can’t keep making so many scientists tear out their hair over well-intentioned but near-infinite administrative requirements, as if that doesn’t distract from the actual science that they are supposed to be doing.”

Yes! https://t.co/7VNDbbEdpZ
